etymologies: early 18th century (denoting the unopened head of a plant): from French, literally ‘summit’, from a popular variant of Latin cyma

definitions: a flower cluster with a central stem bearing a single terminal flower that develops first, the other flowers in the cluster developing as terminal buds of lateral stems.
shortDefinitions: flower cluster with central stem bearing single terminal flower that develops first, other flowers in cluster developing as terminal buds of lateral stems
